text.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: One disk can store the equivalent of 500 pages of text.
text.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the writing that forms the main part of a book, magazine etc, rather than the pictures or notes
text.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: There should not be too much text in children’s books.
text.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a book or other piece of writing that is connected with learning or intended for study
text.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Some of the original text has survived.
Literary texts, like all other works of art, have a historical context.
‘Hamlet’ is a set text (=one that must be studied for an examination) this year. British English
text.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: He sent me a text saying he would be late.
text.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a short piece from the Bible that someone reads and talks about during a religious service
text.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to send someone a written message on a mobile phone
text.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: One disk can store the equivalent of 200 pages of text.
text.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to send someone a written message on a mobile phone
text.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: I’ll text you as soon as I get the news.
